page.title: 05ST.CATHERINES CHURCH
page.content: ST.CATHERINES CHURCH, C DE B The village church of Catherine de Barnes, situated in the old school building, Hampton Lane, is under threat of closure. The small village community who use the school hall as a place of worship, are worried that the Parochial Council will no longer be able to support the small congregation financially. The villagers agree that most of them could travel to another church but St. Catherines is more than a church. The Hall is the centre of village social life with many clubs and socities using its facilities. A village Association is to be formed to organise events and maintain the Hall by renting it out.This they hope will finance the church building. The congregation would be left with the task of paying their share of normal Parish expenses.
